news_header: Chinese hackers targeted phones of US presidential candidates Donald Trump and JD Vance, as well as associates of Kamala Harris's campaign, raising cybersecurity concerns ahead of the election.
news_text: Reports indicate that Chinese hackers have targeted the cellphones of US Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, his running mate JD Vance, and individuals associated with Democratic candidate Kamala Harris. Investigators are trying to ascertain what communications may have been compromised. The hacking group reportedly infiltrated Verizon's systems to access phone numbers of various targets. While the FBI and US Cybersecurity agencies are investigating the unauthorized access, Verizon confirmed awareness of the sophisticated attempt to gather intelligence. Trump's campaign did not confirm the targeting but accused Harris of enabling foreign threats against US infrastructure. The situation highlights ongoing cybersecurity threats to critical infrastructure and the upcoming presidential election.
